text: {'date': 'Feb 17, 2024 | 7:00 pm - 9:00 pm', 'description': 'Song of the North is a large-scale, cinematic performance combining the manual art of shadow puppetry with projected animation to tell the courageous tale of Manijeh, a heroine from ancient Persia, who must use all her strengths and talents to rescue her beloved, Bijan, from a perilous predicament of her own making and help prevent a war.', 'category': 'Arts + Culture,, Entertainment', 'venue': 'Byham Theater 101 6th St Pittsburgh, PA 15222', 'more_details': 'This epic love story employs a cast of 500 handmade puppets and a talented ensemble of nine actors and puppeteers, all of which come together to create a spectacular experience that advances the themes of unity, collaboration, and experimentation through performance and story. Song of the North, adapted from the Book of Kings (Shahnameh), challenges the Eurocentric worldview of art and storytelling through a contemporary multimedia experience of this classic Persian tale.', 'event_name': 'Song of the North'}
contextual_chunk: A large-scale, cinematic performance combining shadow puppetry and projected animation to tell the story of a Persian heroine.

text: {'date': 'Feb 16, 2024 - Feb 18, 2024', 'description': 'The Annual Jubilee Conference is the largest event of its kind and aims to transform students and the world. Join thousands of students for a unique and uplifting experience of worship and dedication to God!', 'category': 'Community,, Convention', 'venue': 'David L. Lawrence Convention Center 1000 Fort Dusquene Boulevard Pittsburgh, PA 15222', 'more_details': 'At the CCO, we’ve been inviting and equipping the church to reach college students since 1971. We’ve witnessed decades of lifelong transformation as people like you have invested in each new generation—as people like you have invested in hope. We see the latest statistics on mental health among young people. We know that today’s college students are tomorrow’s leaders— and yet we wonder what kind of leaders the next generation will be. This is why the CCO partners with the Church to reach the whole college campus—students, faculty, and staff—with the Gospel . We disciple women and men with the Vision that they will join God in His work to restore all things, sending them into society to renew all of life and culture. When lives are transformed by Jesus Christ—especially the lives of young people—the world is changed.', 'event_name': 'CCO 2024 Annual Jubilee'}
contextual_chunk: The CCO 2024 Annual Jubilee Conference is an annual event aimed at transforming students and the world through worship and dedication to God.

text: {'date': 'Feb 14, 2024 | 8:00 pm - 10:00 pm', 'description': 'Kindred The Family Soul or simply referred to as Kindred is one such duo that epitomizes the essence of longevity but evolution and consistency in the modern era.', 'category': 'Arts + Culture,, Music', 'venue': 'August Wilson Cultural Center 980 Liberty Ave Pittsburgh, PA 15222', 'more_details': 'A multi-talented Duo comprised of married couple Fatin Dantzler and Aja Graydon. Kindred the Family Soul has 7 Albums to date and has been making music that is thoughtful, conscious and driven by a desire to motivate, inspire, comfort and spread love and joy to all those that hear it for two decades and the Movement has only expanded and grown. The duo met in 1997 married in 1998 started a family and a group pretty simultaneously and started performing in Philly in a small club called the Five spot with an event called the Black Lily. The pivotal moment came when they met Steve McKeever the president of Hidden Beach Recordings who signed them and the Neo-soul movement of that era spawned a few artists who went on to be successful like Bilal, Jill Scott, Floetry, Musiq SoulChild Ledisi and a few others. The duo has also been nominated for awards such as BET and Soul Train but cites their biggest accomplishment as the sustainability of their art together as a unit and operating independently for more than 10 years in the murky and turbulent circuit of the Music Industry. In 2015 Kindred was highlighted in a Walmart commercial with their entire family in a very successful summer campaign. The versatile duo has also performed a record number of 8 times at Essence Festival and over the years have done countless tours with many of the major artist in the music industry while accumulating several top ten R&B records including “Far Away”, “Stars”, “Where would I Be”, “All My People” and more. Kindred the Family Soul wish to bridge together all of their creative endeavors into the curation of their new digital streaming platform Legacy Network especially in the wake of the worldwide pandemic. The hope is that the music and independent content can become an outlet of escape and comfort for viewers and listeners.', 'event_name': 'Soul Sessions: Kindred the Family Soul'}
contextual_chunk: Soul Sessions: Kindred the Family Soul is a multi-talented duo consisting of married couple Fatin Dantzler and Aja Graydon, known for their 7 albums and 20-year career in neo-soul music.

text: {'date': 'Feb 13, 2024 | 5:30 pm - 7:00 pm', 'description': 'Join Pittsburgh Public Theater and Barrel & Flow for a night of laughs, lessons, & libations as attendees are guided through a sampling of local Black owned boozes by the owners of Windy Bridges Brew llc., Noire Distillery, TLC Libations, & DOPE Cider House & Winery.', 'category': 'Arts + Culture,, Entertainment', 'venue': "O'Reilly Theater 621 Penn Ave Pittsburgh, PA 15222", 'more_details': 'Seating is limited, so reserve your spot today Tuesday, February 13 Barrel & Flow Tasting: 5:30 p.m. Showtime: 7:00 p.m. Package price: $80', 'event_name': 'Theater On Tap'}

text: {'date': 'Feb 13, 2024 | 5:00 pm - 7:00 pm', 'description': 'When world-renowned trumpeter Sean Jones described Tania Grubbs, he said knowing her has been a joy, “not only because of her skill as an artist but because of her connection to humanity.”?', 'category': 'Arts + Culture,, Free event,, Music', 'venue': 'Greer Cabaret Theater 655 Penn Ave Pittsburgh, PA 15222', 'more_details': 'There probably couldn’t be two more perfect words to describe not only Tania but her fascinating, beautiful music: joy and humanity. Tania Grubbs is a very appealing jazz singer whose light voice and quiet expressive style are a bit reminiscent at times of Irene Kral. She learned about jazz and singing while attending Youngstown State University, met her husband bassist Jeff Grubbs, lived and worked in Fort Lauderdale, Florida (performing along South Florida’s coast), sang at many of its clubs and with the Florida Philharmonic Orchestra, and has been based in Pittsburgh for the past two decades. She has been a major force on the local jazz scene as a singer and educator. In 2014 she released her debut CD, Lost In The Stars.', 'event_name': 'Tania Grubbs Quartet'}
contextual_chunk: Tania Grubbs, a jazz singer based in Pittsburgh, is celebrated for her joyful and humanistic performances.

text: {'date': 'Feb 10, 2024 - Apr 28, 2024', 'description': 'This is not a map brings together eight artists from Carnegie Mellon University’s Master of Fine Arts program.', 'category': 'Arts + Culture,, Free event', 'venue': 'SPACE Gallery 812 Liberty Ave Pittsburgh, PA 15222', 'more_details': 'This collection of new works addresses contemporary notions of place, time, and storytelling. Hailing from five continents, all now living and working in Pittsburgh, the artists are each presenting an installation informed by their diverse studio practices, utilizing a broad range of mediums, from textiles and collages to video essays and digital sculpture. Where traditional mapmaking creates rigid understandings of constructs like nationhood, gender, and language, this exhibition offers fluid systems of way-finding between shifting and interlaced worlds. A dance is re-choreographed, an altar calls the past into the present, discarded objects find a new sense of value, and sensory fragments from childhood are restaged. Memory plays a vital role across the works on view, exploring how a body can chart through space on its own terms. Artists: Izsys Archer (MFA ‘25) Naomi Chambers (MFA ‘26) Tingting Chen (MFA ‘25) Chantal Feitosa-Desouza (MFA ‘25) Frankmarlin (MFA ‘25) Bulumko Mbete (MFA ‘26) Afrooz Partovi (MFA ‘26) Max Tristan Watkins (MFA ‘25) This is not a map is presented by the Pittsburgh Cultural Trust in collaboration with Carnegie Mellon University. Special thanks to MFA Director Katherine Hubbard, Assistant Director Julie Hakim Azzam, Head of the School of Art Charlie White, and the College of Fine Arts at Carnegie Mellon University. Additional thanks to the Pittsburgh Cultural Trust team: Davine Byon, Tara Fay Coleman, Jesse Hulcher, George Dun, Kennedy Deen, Josh Rievel, and Chris Korch.', 'event_name': 'This is not a map'}
contextual_chunk: This is not a map is a free event featuring eight artists from Carnegie Mellon University's MFA program, showcasing contemporary works addressing notions of place, time, and storytelling at SPACE Gallery in Pittsburgh.

text: {'date': 'Feb 10, 2024 | 9:00 am - 12:00 pm', 'description': 'This active workshop will offer practical information for educators interested in making their early childhood classrooms more active and engaging by including the arts in circle time and throughout the day.', 'category': 'Arts + Culture,, Workshops & Classes', 'venue': 'Trust Arts Education Center 807 Liberty Ave Pittsburgh, PA 15222', 'more_details': 'Educators will: participate in child-centered story extension, including several domains of the performing arts; address emerging literacy skills through the use of decoding, recall, sequencing, patterning, phonemic awareness and prosody; explore rhythm basics with simple instruments and large motor activity; apply the basics of pitch, beat, and singing in tune to music in movement activities with young children; utilize important concepts of movement, including personal and general space, to help children move safely and creatively in the classroom; apply developmentally appropriate math concepts to the music and movement activities. Breakfast provided and Act 48 and PQAS credits available.', 'event_name': 'Jump Off the Page! Using Music and Movement to Make Picture Books Come Alive'}
contextual_chunk: A workshop offering practical information on incorporating the arts into early childhood education, focusing on making picture books come alive through music and movement.

text: {'date': 'Feb 10, 2024 | 8:00 pm - 10:00 pm', 'description': 'Les Ballets Trockadero de Monte Carlo brings its internationally beloved troupe of male dancers to Pittsburgh to perform a brilliant combination of skillful pointe work and hilarious parodying of classical ballet favorites.', 'category': 'Arts + Culture,, Entertainment', 'venue': 'Byham Theater 101 6th St Pittsburgh, PA 15222', 'more_details': 'Founded in New York City in 1974, the company, affectionately known as the Trocks, began by appearing in late-late shows in off-off Broadway lofts for small audiences who appreciated the iconoclastic humor of it all. In the 50 years since then, the company has grown to achieve great appeal among more mainstream audiences who, each season, flock to theaters throughout the world to see these prima ballerinas perform. Revered by ballet aficionados as well as the uninitiated—those who don’t know a plié from a jeté —the Trocks are “a guaranteed hoot for people who know nothing of ballet and an absolute must for those who think they know the originals.” Sydney Star Observer', 'event_name': 'Les Ballets Trocadero de Monte Carlo'}
contextual_chunk: The Les Ballets Trocadero de Monte Carlo performance features male dancers performing a blend of skillful pointe work and humorous parodies of classical ballet.

text: {'date': 'Feb 9, 2024 - Feb 11, 2024', 'description': 'Enjoy big-time family fun at Monster Jam®, where the world’s best drivers and their 12,000-pound monster trucks tear up the dirt in intense competitions of speed and skill.', 'category': 'Entertainment', 'venue': 'PPG Paints Arena 1001 Fifth Ave Pittsburgh, PA 15219', 'more_details': 'Witness crazy skills and all-out racing in fierce head-to-head battles for the Event Championship. text: {'date': 'Feb 8, 2024 | 7:00 pm - 9:00 pm', 'description': "Honoring Rennie Harris Puremovement's 30th anniversary, legendary choreographer Rennie Harris returns to The great city of Pittsburgh, PA with his classic work, Rome & Jewels.", 'category': 'Arts + Culture,, Entertainment', 'venue': 'PNC Theater 350 Forbes Avenue Pittsburgh, PA 15222', 'more_details': "Set in the streets of Philadelphia, the Bessie Award-winning production is a story of fear, love, and triumph, rooted in the traditions of Hip-Hop and street dance. “The Basquiat of the U.S. contemporary dance scene” (The London Times), Harris reinvents a timeless tale to embody the diverse African-Diasporic traditions of the past and to pave the way for innovative storytelling through dance. Content Advisory: Rome & Jewels contains strong language. 2023 Rennie Harris Presents: Rome & Jewels is a New was the York Times Critic's Pick! Click here to read the full review by Brian Seibert.", 'event_name': 'Rennie Harris: Rome & Jewels'}
contextual_chunk: Rennie Harris presents "Rome & Jewels" at PNC Theater in Pittsburgh, PA, marking the 30th anniversary of his iconic choreography.

text: {'date': 'Feb 8, 2024 - Feb 11, 2024', 'description': 'The Pack is back and on a roll from our Lookout Tower to your city!', 'category': 'Entertainment,, Family', 'venue': 'Benedum Center 7th St and Penn Ave Pittsburgh, PA 15222', 'more_details': "Mayor Goodway is getting everything shipshape for a big Pirate Day celebration in Adventure Bay. When Cap’n Turbot falls into a dark and mysterious cavern, it’s PAW Patrol to the rescue! Chase, Marshall, Rubble, Skye, Rocky and Zuma save Cap'n Turbot and discover a secret pirate treasure map that leads them on an epic adventure. Things get ruff when Mayor Humdinger wants to find the treasure first for Foggy Bottom. The pups need all paws on deck for this pirate adventure, including help from the newest pup who’s all ears…Tracker! Using their heroic rescue skills, problem solving and teamwork, the pups set sail to save the day. No job is too big, no pirate pup is too small!", 'event_name': 'PAW Patrol Live! "Great Pirate Adventure"'}
contextual_chunk: PAW Patrol Live! "Great Pirate Adventure" is a family event featuring the adventures of the PAW Patrol pups in a pirate-themed celebration.

text: {'date': 'Feb 8, 2024 | 6:00 pm - 9:30 pm', 'description': 'Join us for the launch of the Carnegie Connectors opens in a new window, a new membership for young professionals at the Carnegie Museums of Pittsburgh.', 'category': 'Community,, Workshops & Classes', 'venue': 'Carnegie Science Center 1 Allegheny Ave Pittsburgh, PA 15212', 'more_details': 'For this special evening, take a journey back in time with stories of real people told through authentic artifacts and immersive environments at TITANIC: The Artifact Exhibition. Allow your imagination to transport you to the “Ship of Dreams” from its construction to life on board, to the infamous sinking through dramatic room re-creations and 154 authentic artifacts. Read the heart-bounding ice warnings leading up to a simulated iceberg chilled to the temperature of the water the night of the disaster. Touch the iceberg and marvel at items honorably and carefully recovered from the Titanic wreck site, about 12,500 feet below sea level. Enjoy complimentary drinks, light bites, activities and more. Costumes are encouraged! This event is free for Carnegie Connectors Young Professionals Members, and $35 for other membership levels and nonmembers. *You must be 21 years of age or older to attend this event. Valid ID is required for entry.', 'event_name': 'Carnegie Connectors Young Professionals TITANIC: The Artifact Exhibition'}
contextual_chunk: The Carnegie Connectors Young Professionals TITANIC: The Artifact Exhibition is a special event at the Carnegie Museums of Pittsburgh, featuring immersive exhibits and activities related to the Titanic.

text: {'date': 'Feb 7, 2024 | 5:30 pm - 8:00 pm', 'description': 'Join the African American Program for a free virtual screening of “Through a Lens Darkly: Black Photographers and the Emergence of a People.”', 'category': 'Arts + Culture,, Film & Movies,, Free event,, Online & Virtual Events', 'venue': 'Virtual Event', 'more_details': 'Presented as part of the From Slavery to Freedom Film Series, “Through a Lens Darkly: Black Photographers and the Emergence of a People” explores the role of photography in shaping the identity, aspirations, and social emergence of African Americans, from slavery to today. Deborah Willis , Ph.D. , photo historian and author of “Reflections in Black,” the book which the film is based upon, will join the broadcast following the screening to discuss the movie. Willis is a MacArthur Genius Fellow and a Guggenheim Fellow, a New York University (NYU) Professor and Chair of the Department of Photography & Imaging at the Tisch School of the Arts, and the director of NYU’s Center for Black Visual Culture/Institute for African American Affairs. Her research examines photography’s multifaceted histories, visual culture, contemporary women photographers, and beauty. The From Slavery to Freedom Film Series is presented by the History Center’s African American Program and is supported by Highmark and Allegheny Health Network .', 'event_name': 'From Slavery to Freedom Film Series: Through a Lens Darkly'}
contextual_chunk: A free virtual screening of "Through a Lens Darkly: Black Photographers and the Emergence of a People" as part of the From Slavery to Freedom Film Series, featuring Deborah Willis discussing the film.

text: {'date': 'Feb 6, 2024 | 5:00 pm - 7:00 pm', 'description': 'Salsamba is a Latin jazz quintet that blends the traditions of American jazz with the spicy rhythms of Cuba, Brazil and the Caribbean.', 'category': 'Arts + Culture,, Free event,, Music', 'venue': 'Greer Cabaret Theater 655 Penn Ave Pittsburgh, PA 15222', 'more_details': 'The group, capable of many musical moods, entertains its listeners with percussive and melodic improvisation of the highest quality. Based in Pittsburgh, Salsamba performs at clubs, festivals and colleges throughout the United States and have opened for many national and international stars including Latin jazz king Tito Puente, guitarists John Scofield and Stanley Jordan, steel drum player Andy Narell and flutist Dave Vallentin. Salsamba has released six critically-praised and commercially-successful CDs, and have been featured performers on National Public Radioâ€™s American Jazz Radio Festival, which airs nationwide on over 125 stations.', 'event_name': 'Salsamba'}
contextual_chunk: Salsamba is a Latin jazz quintet blending American jazz with Cuban, Brazilian, and Caribbean rhythms, performing at clubs, festivals, and colleges across the United States.

text: {'date': 'Feb 5, 2024 | 11:30 am - 1:00 pm', 'description': 'PHLF docents are on hand to tell you the story of the former Allegheny County Jail.', 'category': 'Free event,, Tours', 'venue': 'The Jail Museum 440 Ross St Pittsburgh, PA 15219', 'more_details': 'Open on the first and third Mondays of the month except on Court holidays. Visit at your convenience between 11:30 a.m. and 1:00 p.m. Cost: Free PHLF docents are on hand to tell you the story of the former Allegheny County Jail. Completed in 1886 to the designs of Boston architect H. H. Richardson, it closed on July 27, 1995. The building was then renovated between 1995 and 2001 and adapted for a new use as the Family Division of the Allegheny County Court of Common Pleas. Working with the leadership of Allegheny County and with funding from the Drue Heinz Trust, our organization coordinated with the former jail’s Deputy Warden Ed Urban and the Allegheny County Juvenile Court to preserve one portion of the cell blocks of the historic jail to create the Old Allegheny County Jail Museum. The Jail Museum, which is located in Downtown— at 440 Ross Street, Pittsburgh, PA 15219— opened in 2005. To access the Museum: Enter the Family Court building through the main entrance on Ross Street. You will then be processed through a security checkpoint. The use of cameras is NOT permitted. For further information––or to double-check that the Jail Museum will be open on a particular Monday, contact Mary Lu Denny: at marylu@phlf.org or call 412-471-5808, ext. 527.', 'event_name': 'Visit The Old Allegheny County Jail and Museum'}
contextual_chunk: PHLF docents tell the story of the former Allegheny County Jail, now a museum in Pittsburgh.

Working with the leadership of Allegheny County and with funding from the Drue Heinz Trust, our organization coordinated with the former jail’s Deputy Warden Ed Urban and the Allegheny County Juvenile Court to preserve one portion of the cell blocks of the historic jail to create the Old Allegheny County Jail Museum. The Jail Museum, which is located in Downtown— at 440 Ross Street, Pittsburgh, PA 15219— opened in 2005. To access the Museum: Enter the Family Court building through the main entrance on Ross Street. You will then be processed through a security checkpoint. The use of cameras is NOT permitted. For further information––or to double-check that the Jail Museum will be open on a particular Monday, contact Mary Lu Denny: at marylu@phlf.org or call 412-471-5808, ext. 527.', 'event_name': 'Visit The Old Allegheny County Jail and Museum'}
contextual_chunk: A free event to visit the Old Allegheny County Jail and Museum on the first and third Mondays of the month, open from 11:30 a.m. to 1:00 p.m., with docents available to tell the story of the historic jail.

text: {'date': 'Feb 4, 2024 | 1:00 pm - 3:00 pm', 'description': 'Learn how to make sense of the names on cemetery stones.', 'category': 'Community,, Online & Virtual Events,, Workshops & Classes', 'venue': 'Virtual Event', 'more_details': 'Headstone inscriptions provide one of the most important tools for researching Jewish genealogical history: patronymic naming, or names derived from paternal ancestors. This presentation will familiarize attendees with the evolution of family surnames and the practice of patronymic naming. Recognizing the components of patronymic naming, participants will learn how to take advantage of these clues to link their family through generations. Nolan Altman will review an actual case study using headstone inscriptions and will show participants online resources to help find headstone information. Altman will also show examples of headstones and explain what you’re likely to find if you take a trip to the cemetery. He will explain the meaning of symbols that you will find on stones. Even if you can’t read Hebrew, you can understand the inscriptions. He will also show many examples of inscription trends, some odd inscriptions, and errors in inscriptions…even well-known ones. With a presentation on cemetery records, you wouldn’t expect to leave laughing, but he guarranties you will. This program is possible through the generous support of the William M. Lowenstein Genealogical Research Endowment Fund of the Jewish Community Foundation. “Patronymic Naming and Cemetery Research” is a collaboration between the Jewish Genealogy Society of Pittsburgh and the Rauh Jewish Archives at the Heinz History Center. Please register online. The program is free for JGS-Pittsburgh members and $5 for the general public. To become a member of the JGS-Pittsburgh and receive a free membership code for this program, please visit its website . This program will be recorded and made available to current JGS-Pittsburgh members.  Nolan Altman was bit by the “genealogy bug” when he was inspired to write his family history in 1996 in memory of his mother. After making use of the valuable information on JewishGen , he volunteered to do data entry on various projects. In time, he was asked to become the Coordinator for JewishGen’s Holocaust Database and subsequently the Coordinator for the JOWBR (JewishGen’s Online Worldwide Burial Registry) project. Nolan works with volunteers from around the world helping to grow both databases for the benefit of family members and researchers. Nolan currently holds the position of JewishGen’s Director for Data Acquisition and focuses on growing the JOWBR , Holocaust and Memorial Plaques databases. In 2021, JOWBR won the IAJGS Outstanding Project Award. ', 'event_name': 'Patronymic Naming and Cemetery Research'}
contextual_chunk: A workshop on understanding headstone inscriptions for Jewish genealogical research.

They ’ re always so beautiful” - Lindsay Williams, PA State Senator “ I love this event, because what it really does is it brings multiple generations together” - Rich Fitzgerald, Allegheny County Executive Lunar New Year is the most important holiday celebrated by many international communities all over the world. This year Pittsburgh Chinese Culture Center (PCCC) collaborates with Point Park University's Pittsburgh Playhouse for the second time to present Greater Pittsburgh Lunar New Year Gala celebrating the Year of Dragon. PCCC’s own Performing Arts Group, together with Yanlai Dance Academy, Xiaobo Waist Drum Dance Group, Win-win Kung Fu, and others will share the stage at the Gala. They are joined by performers from Carnegie Mellon University and Point Park University. The Gala also features following special guest artists: The Pittsburgh Chinese Cultural Center (PCCC) is a non-profit organization in Pennsylvania that promotes the awareness of Chinese culture and appreciation of cultural diversity, facilitates assimilation of Chinese immigrants into the Pittsburgh community and supports relations between Pittsburgh and China. For more information, visit www.pghccc.org .", 'event_name': '2024 Greater Pittsburgh Lunar New Year Gala'}

text: {'date': 'Feb 3, 2024 | 7:00 pm - 9:00 pm', 'description': 'This concert pays tribute to the spirit and richness of Black music in America—and its enduring strength in times of tumult and trouble.', 'category': 'Arts + Culture,, Music', 'venue': 'Heinz Hall 600 Penn Ave Pittsburgh, PA 15222', 'more_details': 'Join the Pittsburgh Symphony Orchestra, conductor Anthony Parnther, and special guests for an evening that uplifts and amplifies community. The concert features GRAMMY® Award winner Oleta Adams, whose gospel-rooted voice has graced era-defining albums like Tears For Fears’ "The Seeds of Love” (1989) and her own platinum-selling “Circle of One” (1990). The Lift Every Voice Unity Choir conducted by Nikki Porter and trombonist Cooper Cromwell-Whitley join the program to make hearts and voices soar. All ages welcome. Come early at 6:00 p.m. to experience the exhibit “I Too Play: Unveiling the History of Black Classical Musicians in Pittsburgh” curated by Candance Burgess. Stay after to hear a Jazz Ensemble from AAMI (Afro American Music Institute) in the Grand Lobby of Heinz Hall. • Lift Ev’ry Voice and Sing • Florence Price: First Movement from Symphony No. 3 • Lars-Erik Larsson: Concertino for Trombone • Selections sung by Oleta Adams (to be announced from stage)', 'event_name': 'Lift Every Voice'}
contextual_chunk: A concert honoring Black music in America featuring GRAMMY Award winner Oleta Adams, special guests, and a Jazz Ensemble from AAMI.

text: {'date': 'Feb 2, 2024 | 7:30 pm - 9:00 pm', 'description': 'Our Resonance Chamber Orchestra and Chorus take center stage in February with two concert performances centered around Indian-American composer Reena Esmail’s 2016 work This Love Between Us: Prayers for Unity and Bach’s glorious Magnificat.', 'category': 'Arts + Culture,, Music', 'venue': 'Trinity Cathedral 328 Sixth Ave Pittsburgh, PA 15222', 'more_details': 'One of the most exciting voices in music today, Esmail works between the worlds of Hindustani and Western classical music traditions, aiming to bring communities together through the creation of equitable musical spaces. This Love Between Us reflects on the themes of unity and kindness, juxtaposing texts from seven different religious traditions (and in seven different languages!) Building on the success of our “remarkable” (onStage Pittsburgh) Mass in B Minor last season, Bach’s sparkling Magnificat anchors the first half of the program along with Breaking Bread , a solo work by American composer Nkeiru Okoye , which serves as a kind of invocation for the mesmerizing sonic journey to come.', 'event_name': 'This Love Between Us'}
contextual_chunk: Resonance Chamber Orchestra and Chorus perform Indian-American composer Reena Esmail's "This Love Between Us" and Bach's Magnificat in February.

text: {'date': 'Feb 2, 2024 - Feb 3, 2024 | 7:00 pm - 9:00 pm', 'description': 'An ancient white whale, a captain steering his ship into destruction, and the inner storms of the human heart.', 'category': 'Arts + Culture,, Entertainment', 'venue': 'Byham Theater 101 6th St Pittsburgh, PA 15222', 'more_details': 'MOBY DICK is the tale of a whaling expedition, but also the story of an obsession or an investigation into the unexplained mysteries of life. To quote Melville: “It is the image of the ungraspable phantom of life; and this is the key to it all.” With seven actors, 50 puppets, video projections, a drowned orchestra, and a whale-sized whale, Yngvild Aspeli stages this visual adaptation of this wonderful beast of a book.', 'event_name': 'Moby Dick'}
contextual_chunk: A visual adaptation of Herman Melville's "Moby-Dick" with puppetry, video projections, and a giant whale.

text: {'date': 'Feb 16, 2024 - Feb 18, 2024', 'description': 'A work that caused a stir', 'category': 'Arts + Culture,, Music', 'venue': 'Heinz Hall 600 Penn Ave Pittsburgh, PA 15222', 'more_details': '“My new symphony must be such as to make a stir in the world.” These prophetic words from Dvo?ák were answered with a work considered to be one of the composer’s best. Written in the gray area of hoping for peace while also yearning for patriotic reform, Dvo?ák expressed this inner struggle in his epic symphony. Hailed as the “new cello genius” by Le Figaro, cellist Pablo Ferrández makes his PSO debut with Shostakovich’s First Cello Concerto. Composer Katherine Balch will be present for all performances. The co-commission of Katherine Balch’s musica pyralis is part of New Music USA’s Amplifying Voices program, which fosters collaboration and collective action between US orchestras and composers toward racial and gender equity in classical music. Amplifying Voices is powered by the Sphinx Venture Fund, with additional support from ASCAP, the Sorel Organization, the Virginia B. Toulmin Foundation, and The Wise Family Charitable Foundation. For more information on the Amplifying Voices program, visit Amplifying Voices – New Music USA .', 'event_name': 'Bohemian Spirit: Manfred Conducts Dvorák'}
contextual_chunk: A symphony by Dvo?ák, featuring Shostakovich's First Cello Concerto and a collaborative work by Katherine Balch, performed by Manfred conducting Bohemian Spirit.

text: {'date': 'Feb 7, 2024 - Feb 25, 2024', 'description': 'GANGSTERS… MURDER... KARAOKE?', 'category': 'Arts + Culture,, Entertainment', 'venue': "O'Reilly Theater 621 Penn Ave Pittsburgh, PA 15222", 'more_details': 'After Grandma Porkalob’s birthday party karaoke antics, you’ll never hear “House of the Rising Sun” or “Gangsta’s Paradise” the same way again. Broadway star Sara Porkalob belts out the funny and fearless tale of her Filipino gangster family’s sordid and often laugh-out-loud past in a musical that will have all generations buzzing. Each pitch-perfect performance is more transcendent than the last, garnering Sara the title of “POWERHOUSE…a FORCE and a PHENOMENON” ( Boston Globe ). Now, it’s Pittsburgh’s turn to bask in the Porkalob experience with Sara, Grandma Maria, and the countless characters who made their matriarchy really “sing.”', 'event_name': 'Dragon Lady'}
contextual_chunk: Dragon Lady, a musical by Sara Porkalob, celebrates the humorous and fearless tale of her Filipino gangster family's past, featuring powerful performances that have earned her the title of "POWERHOUSE...a FORCE and a PHENOMENON" (Boston Globe).

text: {'date': 'Feb 2, 2024 - Mar 17, 2024', 'description': "What if when you're ready for true love you could design your perfect mate?", 'category': 'Arts + Culture,, Entertainment', 'venue': 'Greer Cabaret Theater 655 Penn Ave Pittsburgh, PA 15222', 'more_details': "WORLD PREMIERE David Rossmer & Dan Lipton (Book, Music & Lyrics) WHAT IF WHEN YOU'RE READY FOR TRUE LOVE YOU COULD DESIGN YOUR PERFECT MATE? Joan Sweete has always been drawn to the old-fashioned idea of true love with one person, which puts her at odds with the wild west of romance in 2063. When she's chosen to try out the Perfect Mate, an emotionally savvy humanoid partner, she thinks she has found her match – but it turns out perfection isn’t all it’s cracked up to be. An original musical rom-com of the future born from Pittsburgh CLO's SPARK Festival. This show contains adult content.", 'event_name': 'The Perfect Mate'}
contextual_chunk: A musical rom-com about finding true love in the future, featuring an emotionally savvy humanoid partner.

text: {'date': 'Mar 30, 2024 | 7:30 pm - 9:00 pm', 'description': 'An interactive comedy game show benefiting Planned Parenthood of Western Pennsylvania!', 'category': 'Community,, Entertainment', 'venue': 'Arcade Comedy Theater 943 Liberty Ave Pittsburgh, PA 15222', 'more_details': 'Bracket Night @ Arcade is a fun, interactive game show where the audience and panelists get to decide the BEST of the BEST STUFF. At every Bracket Night show, you’ll see four hilarious and passionate panelists duke it out in a battle of opinions as pop culture, food, and other stuff move through a competitive bracket. You’re in on the act too, as the audience votes from their seats until a winner is determined! This month, you’ll get to hear four champions of womens’ rights argue what makes the BEST ACTION MOVIE HEROINE, and then you crown the WINNING CHARACTER! Featuring: PPWP President and CEO Sydney Etheredge , PPWP Board Member and journalist Natalie Bencivenga , comedian and Barrel & Flow founder Day Bracey , and Arcade Academy Director and movie podcaster Robin Hitchcock . Proceeds from this event benefit Planned Parenthood of Western Pennsylvania (PPWP). Your generous support empowers PPWP to sustain its mission to provide high-quality reproductive health care services, comprehensive sexuality education and strategic advocacy. Whether you join for just the benefit show ticket or enjoy the VIP post-show reception, your ticket purchase directly benefits PPWP. Be sure to follow @Bracket_Night on instagram to help us complete the bracket for this show!', 'event_name': 'Bracket Night PPWP Benefit: Best Action Movie Heroine'}
contextual_chunk: An interactive comedy game show benefiting Planned Parenthood of Western Pennsylvania, featuring four champions of women's rights arguing what makes the best action movie heroine.

text: {'date': 'Mar 30, 2024 | 2:00 pm - 4:00 pm', 'description': 'ARTfully UPlifting is a newly developed show uniting themes of hope, acceptance, and inclusion for sensory-friendly audiences.', 'category': 'Arts + Culture', 'venue': 'PNC Theatere 350 Forbes Avenue Pittsburgh, PA 15222', 'more_details': 'In a first-of-its-kind for Point Park University, the Conservatory of Performing Arts students will create a variety of live performances showcased in a concert style format. With a diverse offering of the sensational talents of our COPA students, each variety act will range from 90 seconds to 2 minutes in length. Audiences can expect a full-length showcase featuring something for everyone, and most importantly, anyone. There will be two acts with one 15-minute intermission. Each act will offer 40 minutes of entertainment. Audience members are encouraged to bring personal comfort items such as noise canceling headphones, fidget toys, snacks, and weighted blankets. Patrons are welcome to exit and enter the theater as needed. A quiet room will be available off the grand lobby. The Pittsburgh Playhouse is proud to partner with Autism Connection of Pennsylvania', 'event_name': 'ARTfully UPlifting'}
contextual_chunk: ARTfully UPlifting is a sensory-friendly concert-style show uniting themes of hope, acceptance, and inclusion, showcasing the talents of Point Park University's Conservatory of Performing Arts students.

text: {'date': 'Apr 27, 2024 | 8:00 pm - 9:30 pm', 'description': 'In their brand-new format, Well Known Strangers will take inspiration from an audience interview based on a big Coulda, Woulda, Shoulda from their life and weave the information into a hilarious mockumentary-style show.', 'category': 'Entertainment,, Nightlife', 'venue': 'Arcade Comedy Theater 943 Liberty Ave Pittsburgh, PA 15222', 'more_details': 'Coulda been an astronaut if not for never getting the chance to go to space camp? Woulda married a celebrity if not for spilling a drink on their mother? Shoulda worked for Richard Branson on his private island if not for having webbed feet? In their brand-new format, Well Known Strangers will take inspiration from an audience interview based on a big Coulda, Woulda, Shoulda from their life and weave the information into a hilarious mockumentary-style show. You’ll see a world where that “coulda, woulda, shoulda” came true and how it affected the characters in that alternate version of reality. Veteran improv team Well Known Strangers have been performing long-form improv for over a decade. They are excited to make an audience member more “well known” for this one-night-only show!', 'event_name': 'Well Known Strangers presents Coulda Woulda Shoulda'}

text: {'date': 'Mar 30, 2024 - Mar 31, 2024 | 2:30 pm - 4:30 pm', 'description': "Comprised of more than 40,000 oil paintings, this awe-inspiring adaptation of Wladyslaw Reymont's Nobel Prize-winning novel is the latest animated film from Oscar®-nominated directing duo DK and Hugh Welchman (LOVING VINCENT). In 19th-century Poland, the rural village of Lipce sustains itself on its farmland.", 'category': 'Film & Movies', 'venue': 'Harris Theater 809 Liberty Ave Pittsburgh, PA 15222', 'more_details': "Jagna is a beguiling young beauty caught in a lustful affair with married farmhand Antek (Robert Gulacyzk). But when she's forced to marry his wealthy landowner father, it sets off a chain of events that will tear the town apart. Taking inspiration from the Young Poland modernist movement, the paintings range from swirling impressionism to hyperrealism; the film's visually dazzling sequences are bolstered by symphonic folk tunes from rapper and composer Lukasz Rostkowski aka L.U.C. Telling the tragic story of a young woman caught in the cruel hands of the patriarchy, THE PEASANTS is a stunningly immersive experience. Directed by DK Welchman, Hugh Welchman 2023 | Poland, Serbia, Lithuania | Polish language with English subtitles | DCP Rated R", 'event_name': 'The Peasants'}
contextual_chunk: The Peasants is an animated film based on Wladyslaw Reymont's novel, set in 19th-century Poland, depicting a tragic love story and social upheaval.

text: {'date': 'Mar 30, 2024 | 7:30 pm - 9:30 pm', 'description': 'Comedian. Actor. Musician. Advocate. Entrepreneur. Five-time Grammy and Emmy nominee. Margaret Cho’s strong voice has been lighting the path for other women, other members of underrepresented groups, other performers, to follow.', 'category': 'Entertainment', 'venue': 'Byham Theater 101 6th St Pittsburgh, PA 15222', 'more_details': "Content warning: Mature Content Her recent television appearances – guest star on Season 2 of The Flight Attendant (HBO Max), guest star on Season 2 of Hacks (HBO Max) and two Netflix is a Joke comedy specials: Stand Out: An LGBTQ+ Celebration and Jane Fonda & Lily Tomlin: Ladies Night Live – have expanded an already wide-ranging career, and her role as the ‘mother hen’ in the well-reviewed movie Fire Island solidifies why we all love Margaret in the first place. As a comedian Margaret has been named one of Rolling Stone magazine's 50 Best Stand-Up Comics of All Time, one of Vogue magazine’s Top 9 Female Comedians of all time, while CNN chose her as one of the 50 People Who Changed American Comedy. Thankfully, Margaret has more stories to tell, and her production company, Animal Family Productions, has multiple scripted shows in development for 2022 and beyond.", 'event_name': 'Margaret Cho: Live and LIVID!'}
contextual_chunk: Margaret Cho, a five-time Grammy and Emmy nominee, will perform at Byham Theater in Pittsburgh, PA, discussing her diverse career and upcoming projects.

text: {'date': 'Mar 29, 2024 - Apr 4, 2024', 'description': 'Smack in the middle of a high school trip to our nation’s capital, self-possessed teen Lillian (Talia Ryder) breaks off from her classmates, kicking off a journey straight down the rabbit hole of the New Weird America.', 'category': 'Film & Movies', 'venue': 'Harris Theater 809 Liberty Ave Pittsburgh, PA 15222', 'more_details': 'In the rollicking feature debut for both director Sean Price Williams (known for his grotty-beautiful cinematography for films by Alex Ross Perry and the Safdie brothers) and critic-turned-screenwriter Nick Pinkerton, the Eastern seaboard becomes the site for a deranged and hilarious autopsy of contemporary U.S. life in which Lillian becomes an indifferent sounding board to all manner of loquacious, callous oddballs, including a sexually numb, white supremacist pedant (a delightfully committed Simon Rex) and a pair of wildly excitable indie filmmakers (Ayo Edebiri and Jeremy O. Harris, comedy gold). Tying it all together is a performance of remarkable poise and confidence by Ryder (memorable in Eliza Hittman’s Never Rarely Sometimes Always ), who provides the tender center to this cockeyed exhibition of all-purpose mockery. Directed by Sean Price Williams 2023 | USA | English language | 35mm & DCP Rated NR', 'event_name': 'The Sweet East'}
contextual_chunk: A film debut directed by Sean Price Williams and starring Talia Ryder as Lillian, a self-assured teenager who embarks on a chaotic journey through contemporary American life.

text: {'date': 'Mar 29, 2024 | 6:00 pm - 8:00 pm', 'description': 'Join the Veterans Breakfast Club on National Vietnam War Veterans Day.', 'category': 'Community,, Free event', 'venue': 'Heinz History Center 1212 Smallman Street Pittsburgh, PA 15222', 'more_details': 'This Vietnam Veterans Day event will honor and recognize all veterans who served on active duty in the U.S. Armed Forces at any time during the period of Nov. 1, 1955, to May 15, 1975, regardless of duty location. The event will include the presentation of colors by the Vietnam Veterans, Inc., Color Guard and recognition and pinning of our Vietnam-era veterans. Non-veterans are welcome to attend and pay tribute to our Vietnam War veterans, hear their stories of service, and thank them for blazing the trail for every serviceman and woman who came after them. It will also be streamed on Facebook and YouTube .', 'event_name': 'Vietnam Veterans Day 50th Anniversary Commemoration'}

text: {'date': 'Mar 29, 2024 | 7:00 pm - 9:00 pm', 'description': 'Framed in a theatrical narrative amongst panoramic visuals of the artist’s homelands, the audience experiences a musical journey across the breadth and into the soul of island nations of Asia Pacific and Indian Ocean', 'category': 'Arts + Culture,, Music', 'venue': 'PNC Theater 350 Forbes Avenue Pittsburgh, PA 15222', 'more_details': "Framed in a theatrical narrative amongst panoramic visuals of the artist’s homelands, the audience experiences a musical journey across the breadth and into the soul of island nations of Asia Pacific and Indian Ocean, meeting an ancient seafaring ancestry and confronting the impacts of climate change head on, as the performers and youth ambassadors share their island's voice supported through the cinematic sequences. Drawing on a roster of respected first nation artists, the concert features musicians performing irresistible oceanic grooves to soulful island ballads engaging audiences from huge festival stages to intimate theatres. Combining music, spoken word and live cinema with AV projections featuring footage collected during a 3-year film trip across 16 countries guided by the artists on their homelands. Moving beyond the concert experience, Small Island Big Song offers a variety of opportunities for students and audiences to investigate the environmental, political, social and cultural contexts on our oceans’ islands.", 'event_name': 'Small Island Big Song'}
contextual_chunk: A musical journey across Asia Pacific and Indian Ocean islands, combining music, spoken word, and live cinema.

text: {'date': 'Mar 29, 2024 | 6:00 pm - 7:00 pm', 'description': 'Gilda Sheppard, PhD joins LIT Friday to discuss her film SINCE I BEEN DOWN.', 'category': 'Arts + Culture,, Free event,, Online & Virtual Events', 'venue': 'Virtual Event', 'more_details': 'Lit Fridays is a literary-focused, virtual salon presented by the August Wilson African American Cultural Center, featuring conversations and guest performances on the last Friday* of each month at 6:00p EST via Facebook Live and Zoom Webinar. All conversations are moderated by AWAACC Literary Curator, Jessica Lanay.   Gilda Sheppard, PhD joins LIT Friday to discuss her film SINCE I BEEN DOWN. Lit Fridays is a literary-focused, virtual salon presented by the August Wilson African American Cultural Center, featuring conversations and guest performances on the last Friday* of each month at 6:00p EST via Facebook Live and Zoom Webinar. All conversations are moderated by AWAACC Literary Curator, Jessica Lanay. Gilda Sheppard, PhD, is an award-winning filmmaker who has screened her documentaries throughout the United States, internationally in Canada, Ghana, South Africa, the Festival Afrique Cannes Film Festival, Nigeria Abuja Film Festival, and in Germany at the International Black Film Festival in Berlin. Sheppard is a 2017 Hedgebrook Fellow for documentary film, 2019 recipient of an Artist Trust Fellowship, 2023 Best Director New York Independent Film Festival, and awarded Best Feature Documentary for August Wilson Black Bottom Film Festival. Sheppard is faculty Emerita of Sociology, Cultural and Media Literacy at Evergreen State College in Tacoma. SINCE I BEEN DOWN is an American story showcasing one city, Tacoma, WA, as an example of “Everytown, USA.” These are stories told through the eyes of a community impacted by the fear-based policies of the 1980’s and ‘90’s that sacrificed and labeled their most-vulnerable children as irredeemable “super predators.” The film unravels intimate stories from interviews brought to life through archival footage, cinema verité discussions, masquerade and dance to cinematically unravel why children commit violent crime, and how these children now adults are breaking free from their fate by creating a model of justice that is transforming their lives, our humanity and a quality of life for all our children. ', 'event_name': 'Lit Friday: Gilda Sheppard'}
contextual_chunk: Gilda Sheppard, PhD discusses her film "SINCE I BEEN DOWN" at Lit Friday.

text: {'date': 'Mar 28, 2024 | 7:30 pm - 9:30 pm', 'description': 'Divorce and parental roles are at the center of this legal drama that puts husband against wife for custody of their young son.', 'category': 'Film & Movies', 'venue': 'Harris Theater 809 Liberty Ave Pittsburgh, PA 15222', 'more_details': 'Celebrating 100 Years of Columbia Pictures Divorce and parental roles are at the center of this legal drama that pits husband against wife for custody of their young son. Dustin Hoffman ( The Graduate , Tootsie ) plays workaholic advertising executive Ted Kramer who, on the verge of acquiring a major account, is faced with his wife Joanna’s (Meryl Streep) decision to leave him and their 7-year-old son Billy (Justin Henry). Ted faces a whirlwind of challenges as he must balance an overly demanding career with raising a child on his own. Kramer vs. Kramer won best picture at the 1980 Academy Awards, Best Actor for Hoffman and Best Supporting Actress for Streep. Directed by Robert Benton Rated PG', 'event_name': 'Kramer vs. Kramer (1979)'}
contextual_chunk: A film about a husband and wife's legal battle over custody of their young son, starring Dustin Hoffman and Meryl Streep.

text: {'date': 'Mar 27, 2024 | 7:30 pm - 9:30 pm', 'description': 'Now in the seventh decade of his professional life, Herbie Hancock remains where he has always been: at the forefront of world culture, technology, business and music.', 'category': 'Arts + Culture,, Music', 'venue': 'Byham Theater 101 6th St Pittsburgh, PA 15222', 'more_details': 'Herbie Hancock has been an integral part of every popular music movement since the 1960’s. As a member of the Miles Davis Quintet that pioneered a groundbreaking sound in jazz, he also developed new approaches on his own recordings, followed by his work in the 70s — with record-breaking albums such as “Headhunters” — that combined electric jazz with funk and rock in an innovative style that continues to influence contemporary music. “Rockit” and “Future Shock” marked Hancock’s foray into electronic dance sounds; during the same period he also continued to work in an acoustic setting with V.S.O.P. Hancock received an Academy Award for his Round Midnight film score and 14 Grammy Awards, including Album Of The Year for “River: The Joni Letters,” and two 2011 Grammy Awards for the globally collaborative CD, “The Imagine Project.” Hancock serves as Creative Chair for Jazz for the Los Angeles Philharmonic Association and as Institute Chairman of the Herbie Hancock Institute of Jazz. In 2011 Hancock was named a UNESCO Goodwill Ambassador, and in December of 2013, received a Kennedy Center Honor. His memoirs, Herbie Hancock: Possibilities, were published by Viking in 2014, and in February 2016 he was awarded the Grammy Lifetime Achievement Award. Hancock is currently in the studio at work on a new album.', 'event_name': 'Herbie Hancock'}
contextual_chunk: Herbie Hancock's 2024 performance at Byham Theater showcases his enduring impact on music, spanning decades of innovation and collaboration.

text: {'date': 'Mar 26, 2024 | 5:00 pm - 7:00 pm', 'description': 'Roger Humphries began playing professionally at the age of fourteen. He led his own group at Carnegie Music Hall when just sixteen.', 'category': 'Free event,, Music', 'venue': 'Lounge at the Greer Cabaret 655 Penn Ave Pittsburgh, PA 15222', 'more_details': '"I\'ve had a love for music as long as I can remember." He was encouraged by his older brothers Lawrence Jr. and Norman who were musicians at that time. Additionally, Roger\'s son Roger Jr. and Norman\'s son Gregory have followed in their footsteps as professional drummers. After playing with various groups around the country, ace drummer Roger Humphries decided to organize his own group in 1972 which he calls RH Factor and in 1996 he assembled Roger Humphries\' Big Band. Roger gives special thanks to Dr. Harry Clark, principal of The Pittsburgh High School for the Creative and Performing Arts (CAPA) who has allowed him to have such a beautiful experience teaching the kids at the school, and also to Dr. Nathan Davis who gave him an opportunity to teach and shares lives with students at the University of Pittsburgh. Roger has influenced the careers of a number of his students and musicians also through participation in a number of clinics such as the Slippery Rock University Summer Jazz workshop, Mellon Jazz Masters Class and Concerts, and the teaching goes on especially on the stage. Find more about Roger Humphries + RH Factor onÂ rogerhumphriesband.com .', 'event_name': 'Roger Humphries & RH Factor'}
contextual_chunk: Roger Humphries, an accomplished drummer, organized his own group in 1972 and later assembled the Roger Humphries Big Band in 1996. He has influenced the careers of many students and musicians through clinics and teaching opportunities.

text: {'date': 'Mar 24, 2024 | 2:00 pm - 4:00 pm', 'description': 'Hedonism, hypocrisy, and high society', 'category': 'Arts + Culture,, Music', 'venue': 'Benedum Center 7th St and Penn Ave Pittsburgh, PA 15222', 'more_details': "Music by Giuseppe Verdi, with a libretto by Francesco Maria Piave A courtesan among the decadent elite, Violetta Valéry knows that she will die soon so she lives life to the fullest. Only the love of the doting Alfredo can sweep her away from these sensual delights. But while she is a trophy to be won amongst the balls and frivolities of Paris, she is nothing but a scandalous “fallen woman” to genteel society. Violetta and Alfredo’s love threatens to bring shame to his family and ruin his sister's marriage prospects. In secret, Alfredo’s father presses Violetta to shun Alfredo and save the family’s reputation. Heartbroken and health failing, Violetta retreats to her old life of empty pleasures. As her illness worsens, will love slip away as well? Verdi’s exquisite tragedy juxtaposes rousing numbers like the joyous Brindisi with heart-wrenching arias to create a shattering emotional portrait like no other.", 'event_name': 'La Traviata'}
contextual_chunk: A tragic opera by Giuseppe Verdi, "La Traviata," set against the backdrop of high society and the decadence of Paris, exploring themes of love, honor, and the consequences of societal expectations.

Violetta and Alfredo’s love threatens to bring shame to his family and ruin his sister's marriage prospects. In secret, Alfredo’s father presses Violetta to shun Alfredo and save the family’s reputation. Heartbroken and health failing, Violetta retreats to her old life of empty pleasures. As her illness worsens, will love slip away as well? Verdi’s exquisite tragedy juxtaposes rousing numbers like the joyous Brindisi with heart-wrenching arias to create a shattering emotional portrait like no other.", 'event_name': 'La Traviata'}
contextual_chunk: A tragic opera by Giuseppe Verdi, "La Traviata," set against the backdrop of high society and the decadence of Paris, exploring themes of love, honor, and the consequences of societal expectations.

text: {'date': 'Mar 23, 2024 - Oct 6, 2024', 'description': 'From pioneering investigative journalism to leading their country to Olympic gold, Western Pennsylvania women have made an immeasurable impact in America, but too often, their stories have been overlooked.', 'category': 'Arts + Culture,, Tours', 'venue': 'Heinz History Center 1212 Smallman Street Pittsburgh, PA 15222', 'more_details': 'Beginning this spring, the History Center will flip the script and take an unprecedented deep dive into the lives of these fierce and unflappable women who helped change the world inside a major new exhibition, A Woman’s Place: How Women Shaped Pittsburgh , opening on March 23, 2024. Take an interactive, thematic journey through women’s history from the early 1800s to modern day that will showcase the stories of entrepreneurs and activists, artists and athletes, scientists and inventors, and changemakers and barrier breakers. Through more than 250 artifacts, immersive experiences, and striking archival images, A Woman’s Place will reveal how women have made Pittsburgh and the world a better place. Explore rare artifacts like the small handbag carried around the world in 1889 by legendary journalist Nellie Bly, who traveled the globe in just 72 days, more than a week faster than Jules Verne’s fictional character Phileas Fogg in “Around the World in 80 Days.” Discover the stories of “real life” Rosie the Riveters, from the Western Pennsylvanians who worked the mills during World War II and helped inspire the iconic Rosie poster, to the modern day “Girls of Steel” – the all-girls robotics team at Carnegie Mellon University. Exhibit highlights include: A Woman’s Place: How Women Shaped Pittsburgh will be on exhibit through Oct. 6, 2024. Stay tuned for more information on public programs, exhibit tours, and other happenings.', 'event_name': "A Woman's Place: How Women Shaped Pittsburgh"}
contextual_chunk: A Woman's Place: How Women Shaped Pittsburgh, an exhibition at the Heinz History Center, explores the lives and contributions of pioneering women from Western Pennsylvania, showcasing their impact on American history and culture.

text: {'date': 'Mar 23, 2024 | 6:30 pm - 11:00 pm', 'description': 'Come together with friends and fellow professionals in celebration of Family House—Pittsburgh’s premiere healthcare lodging facility—during the 2024 Family House Ruby Jubilee Gala in March.', 'category': 'Arts + Culture,, Community,, Entertainment,, Music,, Nightlife,, Online & Virtual Events', 'venue': 'The Duquesne Club 325 Sixth Avenue Pittsburgh, PA 15222', 'more_details': 'Don’t miss out on the 2024 Family House Ruby Jubilee Gala , celebrating Family House friends, supporters, and partners, as well as 40 years of serving patients and families! Join us and Pittsburgh’s top healthcare and industry leaders for cocktails, conversation, dinner, dancing, a silent auction, and more. Family House is excited to offer the inaugural “ Cocktails for a Cause Reception .” Professionals interested in expanding their networks are invited to a festive after-dinner cocktail reception from 8:00 to 11:00 p.m. at the Ruby Jubilee Gala to learn more about Family House. Approximately 60 attendees will have the opportunity to support the organization while networking and enjoying drinks, hors d’oeuvres, the signature Gala Dessert Bar, and dancing. All funds raised during the event support vital Family House services, and ensure the most affordable pricing possible for patient and caregiver lodging. To purchase tickets, visit https://one.bidpal.net/fhgala2024 . For Gala updates, visit familyhouse.org/gala . A special thanks goes to our Gala Presenting and Cocktails for a Cause Reception sponsors UPMC and UPMC Health Plan , and to our platinum sponsor Lamar Advertising Company for their continued support.', 'event_name': '2024 Family House Ruby Jubilee Gala'}
contextual_chunk: 2024 Family House Ruby Jubilee Gala celebrates 40 years of healthcare services and invites professionals to network and support the organization.

text: {'date': 'Mar 22, 2024 - Mar 24, 2024', 'description': 'The Eagle Spring Show brings together patriots and enthusiasts eager to trade, buy and sell the best selection of guns, gear, equipment and ammunition.', 'category': 'Convention,, Shopping', 'venue': 'David L. Lawrence Convention Center 1000 Fort Dusquene Boulevard Pittsburgh, PA 15222', 'more_details': 'When you think of PA gun shows, you’re thinking of Eagle Shows, home of the largest gun shows in the Keystone State. Deeply rooted in the freedoms we enjoy as Americans, the Second Amendment protects the rest of our constitutional liberties by ensuring our rights to self-defense. At an Eagle Show, you have the opportunity to gather with like-minded patriots to buy, sell, and trade guns, ammunition, gear, and equipment. Find the next Eagle show near you and get your tickets today. When you want a good deal at a Pennsylvania gun show, you want a welcoming environment that brings in sellers, suppliers, and buyers from all over the state and beyond. We’re proud to give you a safe, comfortable venue to find the next addition to your collection, sell firearms and equipment that you’re ready to let go, and meet with people who enjoy freedom and shooting sports as much as you do. Get your table space and find out more about becoming a vendor at an Eagle Show.', 'event_name': 'Eagle Spring Show Pittsburgh 2024'}
contextual_chunk: The Eagle Spring Show, held March 22-24, 2024, is a gun show in Pittsburgh, PA, featuring vendors, buyers, and sellers of guns, ammunition, gear, and equipment.

text: {'date': 'Mar 21, 2024 | 5:30 pm - 7:30 pm', 'description': 'Join us at the Future of Making Learning event, presented by the Maker Learning Collaborative', 'category': 'Community,, Free event,, Workshops & Classes', 'venue': "Sally Ann's 136 6th St Pittsburgh, PA 15222", 'more_details': "Join us for an exciting in-person event at Sally Ann's, 6th Street, Pittsburgh, PA, USA . Have you ever imagined what the future of maker learning looks like in Southwest PA for the next ten years? Four different affinity groups - K12, Higher Education, Out of School Time, and Industry have been working since September to do just that. They were were brought together to form the Maker Learning Collaborative working group with the aim to map out robust, accessible maker opportunities in every community that empower people to pursue creative pathways that positively impact their own lives and the broader community. Join us to explore their findings and recommendations for collaboration. Meet other maker educators and teaching artists during a fun night of dinner, drinks and networking. We will offer an assortment of food including vegetarian and vegan options. If you have any dietary restrictions or any accessibility accommodation needs, please email kmcneil@digitalpromise.org Remake Learning is a free peer network for educators and innovators in the greater Pittsburgh region. The network helps people connect, exchange knowledge, collaborate on new ideas, improve their practice, and find funding to spark more engaging, relevant, and equitable opportunities to enrich Pittsburgh’s learning ecosystem. Join the network here! It's free!", 'event_name': 'Future of Making Learning'}
contextual_chunk: The Future of Making Learning event, presented by the Maker Learning Collaborative, brings together four affinity groups to explore and map out maker opportunities in Southwest PA for the next ten years.

text: {'date': 'Mar 19, 2024 | 5:00 pm - 7:00 pm', 'description': 'Dr. Jason Kush is an acclaimed saxophonist, educator, and scholar.', 'category': 'Free event,, Music', 'venue': 'Lounge at the Greer Cabaret 655 Penn Ave Pittsburgh, PA 15222', 'more_details': 'Kush has performed as a leader, soloist, and ensemble member in various musical settings in the United States, Europe, and Central and South America. A genre-crossing performer, Kush is a member of the Pittsburgh Jazz Orchestra and has performed thirteen seasons with the Pittsburgh Symphony Orchestra, including a European tour. As a freelance artist, Kush has appeared with the Woody Herman Orchestra, Smithsonian Jazz Masterworks Orchestra, New World Symphony, Russian National Orchestra, Maceo Parker, Arturo Sandoval, Eddie Daniels, Paquito D’Rivera, Benny Golson, Sean Jones, Christian McBride, Jeff “Tain” Watts, Freddie Cole, Andrea Bocelli, Hugh Jackman, and many others. Kush’s saxophone talents can be heard on albums by the South Florida Jazz Orchestra, the South Nine Ensemble, the Balcony Big Band, the Mike Tomaro Big Band, the Nathan Douds Ensemble, Madd for Tadd, and the Stephen Philip Harvey Jazz Orchestra. Kush’s most recent recording, Finally Friday, was released on MCG Jazz in February 2023. Kush’s other solo discography includes Intersecting Lines (New Focus Records/Naxos) and Sonate (Armazi Productions).', 'event_name': 'Jason Kush Quartet'}
contextual_chunk: Dr. Jason Kush, an acclaimed saxophonist, educator, and scholar, will perform with his quartet at the Greer Cabaret in Pittsburgh, PA.

text: {'date': 'Mar 19, 2024 | 6:00 pm - 8:00 pm', 'description': 'Sacred Earth explores the interconnectedness between human emotions and the environment that shapes them.', 'category': 'Arts + Culture,, Free event,, Workshops & Classes', 'venue': 'Benedum Center 7th St and Penn Ave Pittsburgh, PA 15222', 'more_details': 'Registration is required Sacred Earth explores the interconnectedness between human emotions and the environment that shapes them. Performed with a stellar musical ensemble from India, the dancers create a sacred space to honor the divinity in the natural world and the sustenance we derive from it. Inspired by the philosophies behind the ephemeral arts of Kolam and Warli painting, and the Tamil Sangam literature of India, Sacred Earth is Ranee and Aparna Ramaswamyâ€™s singular vision of the beautiful, fragile relationship between nature and man.', 'event_name': 'Ragamala Dance Company: Sacred Earth Dance Masterclass'}
contextual_chunk: Ragamala Dance Company presents "Sacred Earth" exploring the connection between human emotions and the environment.

text: {'date': 'Mar 19, 2024 | 7:30 pm - 9:30 pm', 'description': "Trapped in a Japanese POW camp in Burma, obsessive British Lieutenant Colonel Nicholson (Alec Guinness, in an Oscar-winning role) wants order and a strict adherence to the rule of law, so much so that he is blind to the Japanese commander's request to build the eponymous bridge", 'category': 'Film & Movies', 'venue': 'Harris Theater 809 Liberty Ave Pittsburgh, PA 15222', 'more_details': "Celebrating 100 Years of Columbia Pictures David Lean was already well known throughout the world as a director of beautiful and romantic films, typically based on cozy theatrical productions. But he burst onto the scene as a master of the epic with the multiple Academy Award winner THE BRIDGE ON THE RIVER KWAI. Trapped in a Japanese POW camp in Burma, obsessive British Lieutenant Colonel Nicholson (Alec Guinness, in an Oscar-winning role) wants order and a strict adherence to the rule of law, so much so that he is blind to the Japanese commander's request to build the eponymous bridge--an act that Nicholson believes follows the rule of law and will instill discipline on his men, while ignoring the fact that it will help the enemy. Meanwhile, American Commander Shears (William Holden) escapes the same camp, eventually leading a commando force to return and destroy Nicholson's engineering miracle. At once a gorgeous, sweeping epic, director Lean's experience with intimate romances also brings us close to the pain, suffering, and even humor of the men who survive the POW camp. Not to be missed on the big screen! Directed by David Lean Rated PG", 'event_name': 'The Bridge on the River Kwai (1957)'}
contextual_chunk: The Bridge on the River Kwai (1957) is a 1957 epic war film directed by David Lean, starring Alec Guinness and William Holden, based on the true story of a British POW camp in Burma.

text: {'date': 'Mar 16, 2024 | 10:00 am - 12:00 pm', 'description': 'Join us on Saturday, March 16, 2024 at 10 a.m. for our annual St. Patrick’s Day celebration!', 'category': 'Community,, Free event,, Holidays,, Outdoor', 'venue': 'Downtown Pittsburgh', 'more_details': 'With approximately 1/5th of the Pittsburgh metropolitan community claiming Irish heritage, it is no wonder the Steel City boasts one of the largest St. Patrick’s Day celebrations in the country. Irish step dancers, marching bands, military members, community organizations, and even Punxsutawney Phil are just a few of the participants that march down Grant Street every year on the Saturday before St. Patrick’s Day. Rain, hail, or even blizzard conditions cannot stop us from celebrating our Irish pride, especially when “everyone is Irish for the day.” What began more than 150 years ago as a way to honor the patron saint of Ireland has evolved into a city-wide celebration of the pride that comes from being Irish. We welcome you to join us, first for mass at Old St. Patrick’s in the Strip, and then along the parade route. Wear your green (or black and gold), and help us celebrate!', 'event_name': "Pittsburgh St. Patrick's Day Parade"}
contextual_chunk: Pittsburgh St. Patrick's Day Parade is an annual free event celebrating Irish heritage, featuring parades and mass at Old St. Patrick's in downtown Pittsburgh.

text: {'date': 'Mar 15, 2024 | 7:30 pm - 9:00 pm', 'description': 'FINAL EVENT IN THE SERIES! As part of the Serbian contemporary photography exhibition The Wind Got Up in the Night and Took Our Plans Away at 937 Gallery, a film program has been developed as an extension of the exhibition, featuring contemporary documentary films from Serbia.', 'category': 'Arts + Culture,, Film & Movies', 'venue': 'Harris Theater 809 Liberty Ave Pittsburgh, PA 15222', 'more_details': "Tonight's presentation features two films: CENTAR (2018) | 48 mins | a film by Ivan Markovic A vast complex of corridors, atriums and halls: a congress center made to host thousands now stands almost abandoned. The architecture still communicates a past idea of the future, while the materials reveal the current state of the building. Through their relentless effort, the maintenance workers shoulder the duty of restoring the space to what it was imagined to be. Their movements are rituals, but also their own. SPEAK So I Can See You (2019) | 73 mins | a film by Marija Stojnic Conjuring reality and wonder, SPEAK So I Can See You takes us to a seemingly different era, by exploring the world of Radio Belgrade. One of Europe’s oldest radio stations and a true institution of the city, the station still broadcasts original programming and helps keep history, culture, and critical thought, as well as ever-relevant questions about ourselves and the world, from slipping out of memory and mind. Set at the intersection of an observational documentary and a unique sensory experience, the film conjures everyday scenes at the station and immersing interludes exploring the relationship between sound and the space it inhabits. Through a synesthetic blend of sounds, words, notes, echoes and light, we are taken into a unique cinematic soundscape that doubles as a love letter to radiophonic art and its disarming insight into what makes us remember, understand, think, discover, and feel. Directed by Ivan Markovic / Marija Stojnic", 'event_name': 'SPEAK So I Can See You | CENTAR'}
contextual_chunk: Final event in the Serbian contemporary photography exhibition features two films: "CENTAR" and "SPEAK So I Can See You."

text: {'date': 'Mar 14, 2024 | 8:00 pm - 9:30 pm', 'description': 'Everyone Loves Dick is a lysergic, modern Western about the new American West, love, loss, and the transformative power of buying a slightly used automobile.', 'category': 'Entertainment,, Nightlife', 'venue': 'Arcade Comedy Theater 943 Liberty Ave Pittsburgh, PA 15222', 'more_details': 'Dick Ripper left a sleepy trailer park in Lubbock, TX for a new life in Las Vegas. The rearview mirror was aglow with the bridges he burned as his foot stomped on the accelerator of his unregistered Ford LTD. Dick drove across the desert, keeping hydrated with an ever-warming case of Miller High Life, and a single bottle of water. He ripped a tiny piece of the stuff from the tinfoil envelope and placed it under his tongue. The acid, he figured, was stronger and cheaper than coffee. Dick only had two cassette tapes to make the 13 hour trek. The fourth time through “Neil Diamond’s Greatest Hits” is what caused his mind to finally crack. All the radio would give him on a consistent basis was religious talk and angry conservatives. The air conditioning stopped working somewhere around Albuquerque. Everyone Loves Dick is a lysergic, modern Western about the new American West, love, loss, and the transformative power of buying a slightly used automobile. Everyone Loves Dick uses TSTMRKT’s signature “All Gas No Brakes” performance style with a constantly moving, relentless soundscape, film loops, and unhinged story arc. Written, Directed, and Performed by Ernest Hemmings Dramaturgy by Darren Weller Financial Support by the Nevada Arts Council and the National Endowment for the Arts', 'event_name': 'Everybody Loves Dick'}
contextual_chunk: "Everybody Loves Dick" is a lysergic, modern Western comedy about the new American West, love, loss, and the transformative power of buying a slightly used automobile.

text: {'date': 'Mar 13, 2024 - Mar 17, 2024', 'description': 'Rent is a rock musical with music and lyrics by Jonathan Larson loosely based on Giacomo Puccini’s opera La bohème.', 'category': 'Arts + Culture,, Music', 'venue': 'PNC Theater 350 Forbes Avenue Pittsburgh, PA 15222', 'more_details': 'It tells the story of a group of impoverished young artists struggling to survive and create a life in New York Cityâ€™s East Village in the thriving days of Bohemian Alphabet City, under the shadow of HIV/AIDS. text: {'date': 'Mar 13, 2024 | 8:00 pm - 10:00 pm', 'description': 'We welcome back singer-songwriter and guitarist Mary Timony, on a tour supporting her fifth solo album, Untame the Tiger, on Merge Records.', 'category': 'Arts + Culture,, Music', 'venue': 'Andy Warhol Museum 117 Sandusky St Pittsburgh, PA 15212', 'more_details': 'For more than 30 years, Timony has cut a distinctive path through the world of independent music, most recently as vocalist and guitarist of acclaimed garage-pop power trio Ex Hex, but also as a member of seminal post-punk band Autoclave, celebrated leader of the deeply influential Helium, multifaceted solo artist, and a co-founder of supergroup Wild Flag. Described by Sleater-Kinney’s Carrie Brownstein as “Mary Shelley with a guitar” and dubbed “a trailblazer and an innovator” by [Mary’s former guitar student] Lindsey Jordan a.k.a. Snail Mail, Timony has distinguished herself as one of her generation’s most influential guitarists and songwriters. Brooklyn-based youbet, led by songwriter Nick Llobet, opens the evening. Sound Series is an ongoing concert series featuring internationally touring contemporary artists and bands from around the world.', 'event_name': 'Sound Series: Mary Timony with special guest youbet'}
contextual_chunk: Mary Timony, a renowned singer-songwriter and guitarist, performs at the Andy Warhol Museum with special guest youbet in a Sound Series concert.

text: {'date': 'Mar 12, 2024 | 5:00 pm - 7:00 pm', 'description': 'A Pittsburgh High School for the Creative and Performing Arts graduate, Thomas Wendt has been a professional musician since he was 14.', 'category': 'Free event,, Music', 'venue': 'Lounge at the Greer Cabaret 655 Penn Ave Pittsburgh, PA 15222', 'more_details': 'Based in Pittsburgh, Thomas is an active member of the current jazz scene, playing with groups led by Joe Negri, Dwayne Dolphin, Mark Strickland, Kenia, and the Latin Jazz group Salsamba in addition to leading his own groups, including the sextet, Firm Roots. He is also a member of the newly reformed Pittsburgh Jazz Orchestra. Thomas has played with many visiting international jazz greats, including Clark Terry, Donald Byrd, David “Fathead” Newman, Benny Golson, Monty Alexander, James Moody, Jimmy Heath, Christian McBride, Curtis Lundy, and Geri Allen. During the last five years, Thomas has toured with NEA Jazz Master Hubert Laws and played with pianist Alan Broadbent for the Nyack, NY library jazz series. He has recorded with Gene Ludwig, Sandy Staley, Maureen Budway, Steve Davis and Jay Ashby, Joe Negri, David Budway, Ron Affif, Freddy Cole and Sean Jones (w/ the Pgh Jazz Orch.), Gloria Reuben, and Brazilian vocalist Kenia. Thomas has been on the faculty of The Afro-American Music Institute since 1998 and at Duquesne University since 2015, where he teaches drums, chamber Jazz Ensemble, and jazz history.', 'event_name': 'Thomas Wendt Quartet'}
contextual_chunk: Thomas Wendt, a Pittsburgh High School graduate, is a professional musician who has been active in the jazz scene since age 14, performing with various groups and touring internationally.

text: {'date': 'Mar 10, 2024 | 1:00 pm - 2:30 pm', 'description': 'Peek into the stories hidden in “Pittsburgh’s attic” during Treasures in the Archives.', 'category': 'Community,, Free event,, Workshops & Classes', 'venue': 'Heinz History Center 1212 Smallman Street Pittsburgh, PA 15222', 'more_details': 'Join the Detre Library & Archives on Sunday, March 10 to explore highlights from one of the largest collections of historic materials in Western Pennsylvania. The popular annual program delves into captivating stories preserved in the History Center collection and gives you a unique glimpse into Western Pennsylvania’s past through one-of-a-kind documents and photographs. From popular narratives and people to lesser-known stories and histories, Treasures in the Archives deep dives into four topics carefully chosen by our dedicated archivists. This year’s topics include: For one-day only, a special selection of archival materials related to these four topics will be on view for attendees. Deepen your understanding of Pittsburgh’s history and learn more about these one-of-a-kind stories during this signature event on the Detre Library & Archives calendar.', 'event_name': 'Treasures in the Archives'}
contextual_chunk: Treasures in the Archives, a free event at the Heinz History Center, explores captivating stories from Pittsburgh's attic archives, focusing on four topics chosen by archivists.

text: {'date': 'Mar 9, 2024 | 7:00 pm - 9:00 pm', 'description': '“The Mixtape” celebrates 50 years of Hip Hop & the ecosystem of Street Dance.', 'category': 'Arts + Culture,, Entertainment', 'venue': 'August Wilson African American Cultural Center 980 Liberty Ave Pittsburgh, PA 15222', 'more_details': ' “The Mixtape” celebrates 50 years of Hip Hop & the ecosystem of Street Dance. Featuring diverse genres, freestyle & choreography, The Mixtape transforms the stage into a NYC train car and takes the audience on a ride through the different eras of the Hip Hop & Street Dance timeline, while also looking to the future. Each stop on the journey provides a firsthand view into a different era of music and corresponding American folk dance styles (Popping, House, Hip Hop, Breaking, Litefeet, and Krump), each with its own rituals, stories, unique language, and subculture. This evening-length work features original choreography by the 10K Movement Elite Performance Team. This concert will also include music composed by some of the culture’s internationally renowned and underground producers. Orchestrated much like a ballet with an accompanist, Mixtape will also feature a live DJ acting as both the conductor and instrumentation. ', 'event_name': 'The Mixtape: A Street Dance Concert by 10K Movement'}
contextual_chunk: The Mixtape: A Street Dance Concert by 10K Movement celebrates 50 years of Hip Hop and the ecosystem of Street Dance, featuring diverse genres, choreography, and music from internationally renowned producers.

text: {'date': 'Apr 13, 2024 | 2:00 pm - 3:30 pm', 'description': 'A Watch-and-Play Comedy Show for Kids!', 'category': 'Entertainment,, Family', 'venue': 'Arcade Comedy Theater 943 Liberty Ave Pittsburgh, PA 15222', 'more_details': '', 'event_name': 'Penny Arcade: Kids Comedy Show'}
